docs.title: M.resolve_data
docs.text:
function M.resolve_data(data: plugin_template.Configuration?) ->  plugin_template.Configuration {
    commands = plugin_template.ConfigurationCommands?,
    logging = plugin_template.LoggingConfiguration?,
    tools = plugin_template.ConfigurationTools?,
}

@param data - All extra customizations for this plugin.

@return - The configuration with 100% filled out values.

Merge data with the user's current configuration.

docs.title: M.DATA
docs.text:
M.DATA : plugin_template.Configuration {
    commands: plugin_template.ConfigurationCommands?,
    logging: plugin_template.LoggingConfiguration?,
    tools: plugin_template.ConfigurationTools?,
}

docs.title: M.get_slice
docs.text:
function M.get_slice(
  table_: table<any,any>,
  first: number?,
  last: number?,
  step: number?
) -> The table<any,any>

@return The - subset of table_.

Get a sub-section copy of table_ as a new table.

docs.title: M.get_value
docs.text:
function M.get_value(
  data: any,
  items: string[]
) ->  any

@param data - Some nested data to query. e.g. {a={b={c=true}}}.

@param items - Some attributes to query. e.g. {"a", "b", "c"}.

@return - The found value, if any.

Access the attribute(s) within data from items.

Iterate over all of the given arrays.

docs.title: M.reverse_array
docs.text:

@param array - Some (non-dictionary) items e.g. {"a", "b", "c"}.

@return - The reversed items e.g. {"c", "b", "a"}.

Create a copy of array with its items in reverse order.

docs.title: M.is_alphanumeric
docs.text:
function M.is_alphanumeric(character: string) ->  boolean

@param character - Some single-value to check.

@return - If it's alpha return true.

Check if character is a standard A-Z 0-9ish character.

docs.title: M.is_unicode
docs.text:
function M.is_unicode(character: string) ->  boolean

@param character - Some single-value to check.

@return - If found return true.

Check if character is "regular" text but not alphanumeric.

Examples would be Asian characters, Arabic, emojis, etc.

docs.title: M.is_string_list
docs.text:
function M.is_string_list(items: any) ->  boolean

@param items - An array to check.

@return - If found, return true.

Check if items is a flat array/list of string values.

docs.title: M.is_whitespace
docs.text:
function M.is_whitespace(character: string) ->  boolean

@param character - Basically " ", \n, \t.

@return - If it's any whitespace, return true.

Check if character is a space, tab, or newline.

  values: string[],
  prefix: string
) ->  string[]

docs.title: M.lstrip
docs.text:
function M.lstrip(text: string) ->  string

@param text - Some text e.g. " -- ".

@return - The removed text e.g. "-- ".

Remove leading (left) whitespace text, if there is any.

docs.title: M.startswith
docs.text:
function M.startswith(
  text: string,
  start: string
) ->  boolean

@param text - The full character / word / phrase. e.g. "foot".

@param start - The first letter(s) to check for. e.g.g "foo".

@return - If found, return true.

Check if text starts with start string.

docs.title: M.get_selection
docs.text:
function M.get_selection(buffer: number) ->  string[]

@param buffer - A 0-or-more value of some Vim buffer.

@return - The found selection(s) if any.

Gather the selected Telescope entries.

If the user made selections, get each of those. If they pressed without any assignments then just get the line that they called on.

docs.text:
ConfigurationHelloWorldSay.style : ("lowercase"|"uppercase")

A 1-or-more value. When 1, the phrase is said once. When 2+, the phrase is repeated that many times.

docs.title: class LoggingConfiguration
docs.text: • namespace: plugin_template

docs.title: LoggingConfiguration.level
docs.text:
LoggingConfiguration.level : ("trace"|"debug"|"info"|"warn"|"fatal"|vim.log.levels.DEBUG|vim.log.levels.ERROR|vim.log.levels.INFO|vim.log.levels.TRACE|vim.log.levels.WARN)
    | "trace"
    | "debug"
    | "info"
    | "warn" -- | "error"
    | "fatal"
    | vim.log.levels.DEBUG
    | vim.log.levels.ERROR
    | vim.log.levels.INFO
    | vim.log.levels.TRACE
    | vim.log.levels.WARN -- )?     Any messages above this level will be logged.

Control whether or not logging is printed to the console or to disk.

docs.title: LoggingConfiguration.use_console
docs.text: LoggingConfiguration.use_console : boolean?

docs.title: LoggingConfiguration.use_file
docs.text:
LoggingConfiguration.use_file : boolean?

Should print the output to neovim while running. Warning: This is very spammy. You probably don't want to enable this unless you have to.

docs.title: LoggingConfiguration.output_path
docs.text:
LoggingConfiguration.output_path : string?

Should write to a file.

docs.title: LualineConfiguration.display
docs.text:
LualineConfiguration.display : table<string,plugin_template.LualineDisplayData>?

The Raw user settings from lualine's configuration. e.g. require("lualine").setup { sections = { { "plugin_template", ... }}} where "..." is the user's settings.
